Original Sentence: get sentiment: (I will say, the waitress was very sweet and did try to compensate for the chef and owner's poor beh- we gave her a big tip). aspect: waitress

get sentiment: A friend of mine and I bumped into this restaurant last week and it didn't look like any special place on the outside, but when we looked at the menu we decided to give it a try. aspect: place

get sentiment: A hour passed until the waitress came over to give us menus and tell us she would be right back another hour later After trying to order fish she informed us that all fish entrees on the menu was sold out We took a minute to make a second choice and tried to order something else that we were told was also sold out. aspect: waitress
get sentiment: After being ignored by our waiter we complained to the manager who assured us everything would improve. aspect: manager
get sentiment: After our meal,the manager, even took some of his time to sit with us and give us a lesson in Sake 101. aspect: manager
get sentiment: Also, they upped their prices, so I have their old menu, and was surprised when my bill came to over $5 more than it used to (I know, not a huge deal). aspect: bill
get sentiment: Although she was obviously busy, she was helpful in describing certain items on the menu and suggested a duck dish that was out of this world. aspect: duck dish
get sentiment: Anyway we get a table and order some appetizers from one of the waitresses who was pleasently nice. aspect: waitresses
get sentiment: Asked for wine recommendations and the waitress told me her favorites and described them in detail - I don't encounter this much in NYC. aspect: waitress
get sentiment: Bernard is a great host; it didn't bother me a bit that he recited the entire menu to my wife. aspect: host
get sentiment: but the Server informed us that they wanted to make the soup their own and that she hopes we like it. aspect: Server
get sentiment: but the Server informed us that they wanted to make the soup their own and that she hopes we like it. aspect: soup

get sentiment: impressive balcony seating and while they forgot to give us the cold appetizers, the waiter and maitre'd more than made up for it by being most accomodating to us. aspect: maitre

get sentiment: it's a very chill spot to hang with a group, I went there with a bunch of my friends to have drinks for my birthday and we all had a great time. aspect: spot

get sentiment: My ceasar salad amounted to some limp lettuce and mayo strewn around a large plate, and the only way I might have died for the mac and cheese is due to natural causes while waiting for it to arrive. aspect: mac and cheese

get sentiment: My only complaint was that when I tried to go back with some friends on a crowded night, the place was packed, yet they told us there was a 20 minute wait and that we should wait at the bar. aspect: place
get sentiment: My only quibbles are service - which was confused (we waited 10 minutes for menus), and the wine list, which is over-the-top expensive. aspect: service
get sentiment: My party felt like we got put in a dining room for tourist, which must have been the penalty box area for the disgruntled wait staff on duty. aspect: dining room

get sentiment: My vegetable Napoleon was good; although i first got the veggie burger because the waitress mis-heard and stood my friend up for another 15 minutes of waiting to have it served. aspect: vegetable Napoleon
get sentiment: Not including the tip for our server, who we saw twice in an hour? aspect: server

get sentiment: Ok I got the edamame and something from the sushi chef for free, but the quality of food is more important to me than a free small dish (maybe that's why the restaurant gives it to attact new customers. aspect: dish

get sentiment: On Friday night the busboy was sulky verging on rude; he brought the fries (ordered for the entrees) twice before the appetizers came and then again the minute we'd finished them and looked put out to be asked to take the empty plates away. aspect: appetizers
get sentiment: One of our diners didn't like her fish and both the waitress and the manager insisted on replacing it. aspect: fish

get sentiment: One would think we'd get an apology or complimentary drinks - instead, we got a snobby waiter wouldn't even take our order for 15 minutes and gave us lip when we asked him to do so. aspect: waiter
get sentiment: Our waiter never once asked how everything was, as I suspect he knew the kitchen was producing seriously average food. aspect: waiter

get sentiment: Our waiter was a little stressed and brought a couple things out late and as a result, he apologized graciously and gave us wine on the house to compensate for the delay. aspect: waiter
get sentiment: Our waitress was a bit cold but she was still attentive and food came quickly. aspect: waitress
get sentiment: Our waitress was very nice, not snotty - she even gave us a free apertif after the meal (and left the bottle on the table). aspect: waitress
get sentiment: service was attentive at the beginning but the waiter lost us towards the end and we had to flag them down for the check. aspect: waiter

get sentiment: Snack on a bowl of fried chickpeas while you browse the menu, then move onto the tender lamb skewers, which arrive atop a slab of French bread, perfectly poised to catch the meat's sweet drippings. aspect: lamb skewers

get sentiment: So are cooked plates: Marinated Kobe beef practically melts on its skewers, soy-buttered scallops collapse with sweet brine and Chawanmushi custard, quivering in eel-soy broth with black truffles and foie gras, is over the top. aspect: Marinated Kobe beef
get sentiment: So inexpensive that you'd wonder about the sanity of the owners, if they weren't such good cooks. aspect: owners
get sentiment: The appetizer came out cold and the waiter came and took it to the kitchen. aspect: appetizer

get sentiment: The busboys were more helpful than my server who then made me wait at the bar (very crowded with what appeared to be tasty margaritas) to pay the bartender - what's that about? aspect: server

get sentiment: The defining characteristic of this popular restaurant, aside from dirt-cheap hot dogs, is the beverage selection, which includes a light and refreshing papaya juice, an extremely sweet pineapple juice and a sweet and frothy pina colada drink. aspect: beverage selection
get sentiment: The Food Regulars swear by the tamales, which are spongy, well-seasoned and pulled from steaming crocks on the counter. aspect: tamales

get sentiment: The food was good (and the $25 prix fixe made it all that much better), but the dinner started to feel like an assembly line when our appetizer arrived 5 minutes after ordering. aspect: food
get sentiment: The food was pretty good, but due to our large size (~16) the manager asked us to limit our appetizers to just 3 selections b/c he didn't want to overburden his cooks. aspect: manager

get sentiment: The hostess was condescending and the waiter was somewhat absent and unaccomodating (sure, we made a reservation to sit outside but when I asked to be moved indoors after I heard thunder he didn't even try to make it happen, giving me a blank stare and a shrug when I asked what we would do if it rained). aspect: reservation

get sentiment: The trick to the tomato and onions is ask for it light on the onions, heavy on the tomatoes, order steak for one less person than you have in your party and if the steak is too rare, you can cook the individual pieces more by placing them on the platter around the edges. aspect: tomato and onions
get sentiment: The waiter knew about every item on the menu and explained it very well. aspect: menu

get sentiment: The waiters have been there for YEARS and they know their steak is amazing. aspect: waiters

get sentiment: The waitress was no where to be found at all throughout the course of the meal, did not refill a single drink nor did she bother to inquire about my satisfaction with the food or even bring the check at the conclusion of the meal. aspect: waitress

get sentiment: I recently tried Suan and I thought that it was great. aspect: Suan
get sentiment: It was the first place we ate on our first trip to New York, and it will be the last place we stop as we head out of town on our next trip to New York. aspect: place

get sentiment: If you don't mind pre-sliced low quality fish, unfriendly staff and a sushi chef that looks like he is miserable then this is your place. aspect: sushi chef

get sentiment: With so many good restaurants on the UWS, I don't need overpriced food, absurdly arrogant wait-staff who don't recognize they work at a glorified diner, clumsy service, and management that doesn't care. aspect: wait-staff
get sentiment: Although they do the typical what kind of water would you like questions the service was good and overall very relaxing to place to eat. aspect: place

get sentiment: I found it on a cold night, the perfect spot to warm up. aspect: spot

get sentiment: This guy refused to seat her and she left, followed shortly by the four of us, but not before I told him that in my 40 years of world travel, including Paris, that I had never seen such a display of bad behavior by a frontman in a restaurant. aspect: frontman
get sentiment: The wife had the risotto which was amazing. aspect: risotto

get sentiment: Each time we've been, the front of house staff (not the waiters - they're fantastic - but the people who greet and seat you) has been so hideous to us that were it not for the exceptional fish dishes I would never return. aspect: waiters

get sentiment: There's another girl who I can't describe, she is about 5'6" with brown hair, who eavesdrops on your conversation and chimes in - except she only hears the last part of what you said, so her uninvited opinions are often out of context and nothing to do with what you're *really* talking about. aspect: girl
get sentiment: Food was amazing - I love Indian food and eat it quite regularly, but I can say this is one of the best I've had. aspect: Food

get sentiment: I have it a 4 instead of 5 because of the price (just chicken tikka masala - no bread of rice - is $25), which I would expect at a upscale Indian restaurant but this place doesn't have an upscale feel. aspect: price
get sentiment: But if you're prepared to spend some $ and remember to ask if something they offer is complimentary, then this is the place to go for Indian food aspect: place
get sentiment: The hot dogs are good, yes, but the reason to get over here is the fantastic pork croquette sandwich, perfect on its supermarket squishy bun. aspect: pork croquette sandwich
get sentiment: Though it's been crowded most times I've gone here, Bark always delivers on their food. aspect: Bark

get sentiment: What really makes it shine is the food, which is aggressively seasoned with Cyrpriot spices, and all made in-house (even the gyro meat and sausages), and made of much higher quality ingredients that might otherwise be expected. aspect: food
get sentiment: We asked for sides which the waiter than admitted that he forgot to put in that part of our order. aspect: waiter
get sentiment: I book a gorgeous white organza tent which included a four course prix fix menu which we enjoyed a lot. aspect: four course prix fix menu
get sentiment: The service was spectacular as the waiter knew everything about the menu and his recommendations were amazing! aspect: waiter
get sentiment: Can’t believe how an expensive NYC restaurant can be so disrespectful to its clients. aspect: restaurant

get sentiment: Server made several sake suggestions which were very good. aspect: sake

get sentiment: They have a wide variety of fish and they even list which oceans they come from; Atlantic or Pacific. aspect: fish

get sentiment: Sunday afternoons there is a band playing and it is lots of fun. aspect: band

get sentiment: To their credit they removed the dish from the check; but no manager stopped by to ask what the problem was. aspect: manager

get sentiment: The presentation of Snooze is excellent and it is one of those places that you feel more sophisticated just for being there; but peel back the layers and you have an overpriced IHOP with a high brow menu. aspect: Snooze

get sentiment: Sometimes tables don't understand his sense of humor but it's refreshing to have a server who has personality, professionalism, and respects the privacy of your dinner. aspect: server

get sentiment: For a restaurant with such a good reputation and that is usually so packed, there was no reason for such a lack of intelligent customer service. aspect: restaurant
get sentiment: The menu looked great, and the waiter was very nice, but when the food came, it was average. aspect: food

get sentiment: I had the Lamb special which was perfect. aspect: Lamb special

get sentiment: I read reviews that called the restaurant too expensive and I thought to myself, but may be it is worth it. aspect: restaurant

get sentiment: The Four Seasons has history and it is a sort of landmark of New York City restaurants, but trust me, they will charge you through the nose just so that you can say "I've been to the four seasons restaurant". aspect: The Four Seasons

get sentiment: The Four Seasons has history and it is a sort of landmark of New York City restaurants, but trust me, they will charge you through the nose just so that you can say "I've been to the four seasons restaurant". aspect: The Four Seasons
get sentiment: If you are going for the food, it will not be worth it. aspect: food
get sentiment: Service was just ok, it is not what you'd expect for $500. aspect: Service
get sentiment: Yes, the place is classy and beautiful, but they most certainly target the uber whealthy Not the common joe that wants to go all out every once in a while. aspect: place
get sentiment: THE SERVICE IS AMAZING, i've had different waiters and they were all nice, which is a rare thing in NYC. aspect: waiters
get sentiment: The space kind of feels like an Alice in Wonderland setting, without it trying to be that. aspect: space
get sentiment: The atmosphere was pretty nice but had a bit lacking, which it tries to make up for with a crazy scheme of mirrors. aspect: atmosphere

get sentiment: For desserts, we tried the frozen black sesame mousse (interesting but not extraordinary) and matcha (powdered green tea) and blueberry cheesecake, which was phenomenal. aspect: matcha (powdered green tea) and blueberry cheesecake

get sentiment: If you’re planning to come here, make sure that your date is someone whom you really like since you’ll be ushered to private booths where there will be no people or food watching (choose the ones on the ground level that have glass ceilings so you may see the stars in the sky!). aspect: private booths
get sentiment: My party had the BBE $29 fixe prix menu, which was such a wonderful deal since it also came with a flight of sake! aspect: BBE $29 fixe prix menu
get sentiment: I picked the Grilled Black Cod as my entree, which I absolutely devoured while someone commented that the Grilled Salmon dish was better. aspect: Grilled Black Cod
get sentiment: The boths are not as small as some of the reviews make them out to look they're perfect for 2 people. aspect: boths
